Detailed Description

Base class used through derivation or composition to export C++ objects on the bus.

In the section below we will use as example the MyClass class.

Choosing between derivation and composition

Both ways share many similarities, and as far as DBusTL is concerned, both will work equally well.

To use derivation you will type: 

 ...
 class MyClass : public dbustl::DBusObject {
 ...

To use composition you will type: 

 ...
 class MyClass  {
 ...
 private:
   dbustl::DBusObject _dbusObject;
 ...

Exporting a method

Suppose you have a method called sum, that adds two integers a and b, and returns the result: 
 ...
 int MyClass::sum(int a, int b) { return a + b; };
 ...

To make this method visible on the bus you must call the exportMethod() in MyClass's constructor.

If you use derivation, to export a method you must call 

 exportMethod("sum", this, &MyClass::sum);
If you use composition, to export a method you must call 
 _dbusObject->exportMethod("sum", this, &MyClass::sum);

Sending a signal

Suppose you want to send a signal called mySignal containing a string. To do so you must call exportSignal() in MyClass's constructor.

If you use derivation, to export a signal you must call 

 exportSignal<std::string>("mySignal");
If you use composition, to export a signal a bus you must call 
 _dbusObject->exportSignal<std::string>("mySignal");

Note:
You must type in the C++ type of each signal parameter beween < >.
Now sending a signal is as simple as calling emitSignal() when you need it.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

dbustl::DBusObject::DBusObject ( const std::string &  objectPath,
const std::string &  interface,
Connection *  conn = 0 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
objectPath The D-Bus object path where the exported object will be found. Mandatory.
interface The default interface used when exporting signals and methods through this object. Mandatory.
conn The D-Bus Connection used on which the object will be exported. If set to null the object is not visible on the bus until the enable() method is called.

dbustl::DBusObject::~DBusObject (  )  [virtual]

Virtual destructor.

Destructor being virtual means this class is safe to subclass.

Member Function Documentation

void dbustl::DBusObject::setPath ( const std::string &  newPath  ) 

Moves the object in the path hierarchy.

Change is reflected immediately on the bus, including in introspection data.

Parameters:
newPath The new D-Bus object path where the exported object will be found

const std::string& dbustl::DBusObject::path (  )  const [inline]

This object's D-Bus object path.

Returns:
The D-Bus object path where the exported object is be found.

void dbustl::DBusObject::enable ( Connection *  conn  ) 

Export the object on new connection.

If the object was created with a NULL Connection, or object was disabled (see disable() below), enables the object on a new connection. If the object was already enabled on a connection, this has for effect to remove the object from the old connection and add it to the new supplied connection.

Parameters:
conn The new Connection. Must not be NULL. Must be connected.
Exceptions:
DBusException if something fails, such as if there is already an object at the given path.

void dbustl::DBusObject::disable (  ) 

Unexport the object.

The object becomes unreachable from the bus. It can be reexported later on using enable() call.

template<typename _Class, typename R>
void dbustl::DBusObject::exportMethod ( const std::string &  methodName,
_Class *  target,
R(_Class::*)(void)  method,
const std::string &  interface = "" 
) [inline]

Exports a method of the target object on the bus: No input parameter 1 output parameter version.

This is the version with no input parameter.

The method exported will be called by DBusTL transparently when a D-Bus method call request is received. If an exception of base class std::exception or DBusException is thrown by the method, it is translated on the fly and sent as a D-Bus error reply to the D-Bus method call.

Parameters:
methodName method name used to reach the C++ method from the D-Bus world.
target the C++ object whose' methods are exported on the bus.
method the C++ method pointer that will be exported.
interface the alternate interface this method will be exposed on. If not supplied the interface provided to the constructor will be used.

template<typename _Class, typename R, typename T1>
void dbustl::DBusObject::exportMethod ( const std::string &  methodName,
_Class *  target,
R(_Class::*)(T1 arg1)  method,
const std::string &  interface = "" 
) [inline]

Exports a method of the target object on the bus: 1 input parameter 1 output parameter version.

Identical to exportMethod() above, except this is for methods with 1 parameter.

Identical to exportMethod() above, except this is for methods with 3 input parameters.

template<typename _Class>
void dbustl::DBusObject::exportMethod ( const std::string &  methodName,
_Class *  target,
void(_Class::*)(Message method_call)  method,
const std::string &  interface = "" 
) [inline]

Exports a method of the target object on the bus: any number of input/output.

This is the most flexible method to handle D-Bus message, if you want to have a precise D-Bus signature. This is also the most complex to use. The method must do the following:

  • Deserialize method_call using Message::operator>>
  • check deserialization status with Message::error()
  • call Message::createMethodReturn()
  • fill in return parameters with Message::operator<<.
  • check serialization status with Message::error()
  • if an error condition occured somewhere, it can throw an exception that will be sent over the wire as the D-Bus reply, or it can choose to create the error reply manually using Message::createErrorReply()
  • call sendReply()

void dbustl::DBusObject::exportSignal ( const std::string &  signalName,
const std::string &  interface = "" 
) [inline]

Tells DBusTL the following signal can be thrown: no argument version.

This is needed to provide correct introspection.

Parameters:
signalName should be clear enough
interface the alternate interface this signal will be part of. If not supplied the interface provided to the constructor will be used.

template<typename... Args>
void dbustl::DBusObject::emitSignal ( const std::string &  signalName,
const Args &...  args 
) [inline]

Sends a signal on the Bus.

Parameters:
signalName D-Bus name for the signal.
args A list of input parameters passed as reference. The arg list can contain an Interface object, in which case it changes the interface used for this signal.
Exceptions:
DBusException if the signal has not been previously exported, or if the signature does not match with the one supplied to exportSignal().
